message: Because Convore came along and killed it.
Yeah, that could be pretty cool
Perhaps a new feature would be a convore-bot that links convore and IRC channels?
I think once Convore goes public, IRC becomes significantly less valuable
That was kind of my point.
For instance, I once created #modernizr on freenode to help people with questions, but never linger in it

If someone did make a bot, I think a "dumb" one (that made no attempt to translate users, but was just its own user in each location, prefixing each bridged message with the name of the speaker from the other location) would hit 95% of the value with much less effort.
@ericflo you'd need a channel API of some sort that allowed faux-channels and faux-users
I don't think an IRC bridge bot is actually worth it at all.
@ericflo I would an opt-in flag on a profile, where the bot would add messages under your name if it matches a convore user
@ericflo convore->irc, a settable amount be it "x new messages" or a full firehose
@ericflo but really it's an off the cuff suggestion... be pretty useless for 95% of use cases IMHO
